reviews.review_msg: Although the course had WAY too much reading, she was an easy marker and responded well to her students. Do the readings, think critically and participate and you'll do well...She does however, have a long neck and weird stare.

Lectures were v. interesting and I enjoyed coming to class, though we were way too overloaded with readings. She had to keep pushing things back because we couldn't keep up. Good marker, gives multiple chances for feedback. Show up to class and it will reflect in your marks.

LOVED this class! DO your course readings if you want to do well! My final project was so "out of the box" but she was encouraging nonetheless. Never be afraid to e-mail her, ask her questions or come to her with concerns. She always pushes students to do their best with excellent results! I would take a class with her again.

If you are the type who does not read the course readings, STAY AWAY. Midterm paper was EXTREMELY reliant on the course readings so be warned! She is accessible for help but she talks very quietly. Her expectations for assignments are often ambiguous and she often sends out class emails to clarify what she meant to communicate in class.

Bascom is my favourite prof at SFU. He makes class enjoyable to attend. He is also very accessible for any help you need regarding anything. The only thing is that there is a lot of reading per week that you have to summarize in weekly online discussions. But it is still manageable.
